Posts.Title: Spot on chest wall? Just had Mammo Cls1 Cls1

Posts.Content: Aug 22, 2013 03:56PM Cdx wrote: Yes that means that he thinks It's benign. But an MRI because the way its done with contrast, not the typical MRI, they are better able to diagnose. But they never really know anything till they do a biopsy or remove it. But there isn't anything to remove. That being said they can't find a mass or calcification, meaning they don't know what is causing the bulge they see, but it is b9 as far as ca. The doc said to do an MRI to find out if the problem persists and to cover their tush.

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2013 05:36PM - edited Aug 25, 2013 05:37PM by Cdx Cs1 a breast MRI is a specific type of MRI, different then all others in how It's done. I don't know if a chest MRI will show breast, but since it is on the chest it will be able to show what is causing the bulge since it sounds chest related. Good luck and hope It's all figured out soon :).
